request.description:
Retrieve send SMS task information.

This API can be invoked by any client having ```Service2Service``` or ```IVR_SMS``` roles, no specific permissions are required/checked.

request.description:
Update the status attribute of a send SMS task.

In order to change the status of task, task must be in either 'SCHEDULED' or 'CANCELLED' state.

variable.description: (Required) Id of the existing send SMS task

request.description:
Creates a request to send SMS messages to either a single phone number or a list of numbers associated with the customer's outbound campaign.
Up to 500 numbers can be included in a request. Additionally, API client can specify contact information for each supplied
number. When messages are sent, API service will try to locate contact entry for each recipient based on the information provided and
will create new contact entry in case there is none found.

SMS messages will be sent immediately unless ```scheduledTime``` is specified and references moment in the future.

Only international (E.164) numbers are supported. Provided numbers will be validated against opt-in list when messages are sent.
> **_NOTE:_** this API does NOT validate provided phone numbers against opt-in lists when request is created. If message recipient would not opt in by the time the message is scheduled to be sent, message won't be delivered.

This API can be invoked by any client having ```Service2Service``` or ```IVR_SMS``` roles, no specific permissions are required/checked.

Task creation action is idempotent: if multiple valid requests with the same request body are received,
only a single task will be created and the same task id will be returned in response to all requests using the same body sent within 1 hour after task creation.

### IVR Attributes
Those task / recipient attributes for which name starts with the prefix ```Custom.``` are persisted for the recipient / campaign when SMS is sent. If Engagement Workflow is enabled for the campaign, then,
when the recipient replies to the message sent, persisted attributes are available as custom variables in IVR script. Persisted attributes are not deleted when IVR script is invoked and, effectively,
the names of custom variables available in IVR scripts is a combination of the names of all attributes that's been persisted for that recipient / campaign. If multiple attributes with the same name have
been provided, than the most recent attribute value takes precedence over the values specified earlier. In case of attribute with the same name specified for both task and recipient in the same API call,
value of recipient's attribute wins.

> **_NOTE:_** If message has not been accepted for delivery (e.g. because user has opted out), attributes are not persisted.

### Message template
Message templates are message formats for common reusable messages a business may want to send.
Businesses can use message templates for sending notifications to customers.

Template consists of variable placeholders embedded inside text string. Placeholders are defined using the ```{}``` delimiters.

For the following message template example: ```Hello {contact.firstName}. Welcome back.``` message text will look like ```Hello John. Welcome back.``` assuming that first name of the recipient contact is 'John'.

> **_NOTE:_** Make sure that resulting message meets length retrictions, all placeholders are declared within parentheses, and placeholders are not misspelled.

Reserved characters:
1. Characters ```{}``` are reserved to define placeholders.
2. Slash symbol ```\``` is used as escape character. Supported escape sequences are:
   - ```\\``` single slash
   - ```\{``` opening bracket
   - ```\}``` closing bracket

**_Example_**: ```Escape it using \{birthday\}``` will result in the following message: ```Escape it using {birthday}```.

#### Placeholders
Placeholders variables are evaluated using the following rules:
1. Check if placeholder variable is one of the predefined placeholder variables and use
   corresponding  value if so:
   - contact.firstName - first name of the recipient
   - contact.lastName - last name of the receipient
   - contact.email - e-mail of the recipient
   - toPhoneNumber - phone number of the recipient
2. Check if there is recipient attribute with the name corresponding to the value of placeholder and use  its value if so
3. Check if there is task attribute with the name corresponding to the value of placeholder and use its value if so
4. Use empty string

**_Example_**: template ```Hello {contact.firstName}! Use verification code {code}. You can reach support by dialing {supportNumber}.``` will produce message ```Hello Qwerty! Use verification code 000111. You can reach support by dialing 0000``` assuming the following task input arguments:
  - Recipient: ```{"firstName": "Qwery"}```
  - Recipient attributes: ```{"code": "000111"}```
  - Task attributes: ```{"supportNumber": "0000"}```

response.name: Request has been accepted for asynchronous processing
